intro: Hebe tairawhiti, commonly known as the Waitaha hebe, is a shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils, often in forest margins or open areas. Its flowers, which range in color from white to purple, bloom in spring and attract native pollinators. Hebe tairawhiti is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in its native habitat.
